title: Thunderbird doesn't allow new Yahoo email password
content: Last week I changed my Yahoo mail password and updated Apple mail on my devices with no problem. On my iMac, running Monterey OS 12.6.5, I use the latest version of Thunderbird for email. However, it has not accepted the new password, which I enter in the popup window requesting it. (See screenshots) I have tried going into settings/privacy and security and changing it in saved passwords and I've tried deleted saved passwords. I have also entered the secure key. Nothing works. All my mail folders are there. I would really appreciate help on how to get Thunderbird to use my new Yahoo password. Thanks.
creator: DelilahR

title: How could I merge the inbox and sent items into one folder?
content: I would like to use one folder for both sent and recieve and have the conversation display in threaded view so that I can just click on the conversation and scroll through the entire email chain. Similar to how Gmail does it.

title: "Read" emails in my Local Folders inbox vanish
content: Hi Community - I have Thunderbird 113.0b3 installed on my Windows system. Since the regular updates in the last 2 months or so, many or all of the emails that are marked as "read" in the inbox of my Local Folders disappear, without my deleting or moving them. This often happens in the time it takes to click to another folder then click back in to that inbox. Sometimes I can still find those messages via search, but they aren't visible in the folder - and they aren't findable at all if I restart Thunderbird. I'm not using that email account on any other platform, so it's not a question of my deleting them online/on my phone, at all. Any suggestions? Many thanks, Jodie
creator: martire

title: Subscribed ICS calendar stopped loading - 9 others okay
content:
I have 10 subscribed calendars to sync and all but 3 are from different sources. myical.ics, Hawks.ics and F1-2023.ics are from the same source (a folder on my web site - www.peterashby.com/events/). Hawks.ics and F1-2023.ics work fine, as do the other 8, but myical.ics does not display (so I don't know if it syncs or not). This only started happening yesterday. myical.ics syncs perfectly in google calendar and passes a couple of ics validation tests. I tried a new profile but the problem remains the same.

Any ideas please ?
creator: firefox277

title: Requested Thunderbird Enhancement and an Apparent Formatting Error
content:
• Allow Attaching an Email to an Email

When reporting phishing emails to Comcast/Xfinity, they require an email attachment of the offending email, rather than just forwarding the email, so that they can easily read the metadata describing the source of the malware. I have to jump through hoops the provide that metadata (View Source) when forwarding the malware because I cannot attach the email to a new email to Comcast describing the problem.

• When I screen-scrape material with FireFox from a screen with embedded pictures, that material is not properly rendered when pasted into a Thunderbird email. Right-indents accumulate in the email until there is only a tiny-width stream of text and pictures that I cannot left-indent back to the original screen format. Surely Thunderbird should respect the indentation of a screen-scrape from FireFox. MS Outlook does.
creator: dick-lincoln

title: Version 102.10.0 (64-bit) How to make the From: To: pane smaller
content:
Below is a random image of an email. The area (Pane) that contains the From: To: Reply to: and Subject: need to be made smaller. I am aware of the View tab but it does not provide for such a change. Many of the Tabs are greyed out and are of no use. Pressing control and rolling the mouse wheel only changes the actual message. I am hopeful there may be a way to change this somewhere in the registry. Just so you know, the OS is Windows 11. On another PC I use with the same version, but Windows 10, all is perfectly sized - although I still cannot change the size of the pane. It could be a simple mouse click selection under settings or Account Settings but nothing so far has worked. Can anyone help with this issue? I have other problems with how TB is displaying emails but one thing at a time.

Larry K
creator: ldkamb
